alert.note: Alert for St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 2:45PM CDT until May 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A UPSTREAM DAM RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following county, St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 PM CDT Tuesday, upstream dam releases are causing high flows on the Cloquet River and minor flooding in the advisory area. - Discharge from the Island and Fish Lake dams are higher than normal. The Island and Fish Lake Dams are not in danger of failing. High flows will continue through the week but significant further increases are not expected at this time. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hunter Lake, Bowman Lake, Island Lake, Fredenberg, and Taft - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
